content.text: People make presentations to share their views, opinions, ideas and knowledge with a larger group of people.

content.title: Traditional methods
items.Method: Using signals (Flags - Green to go, Red to stop)

items.name: Slide Projector (OHP)
items.description: Transparent sheets used on overhead projector. Notes can be written on them. Limitations: Cannot erase and reuse, No audio/video.

items.name: Overhead Projector
items.description: Transparencies prepared in lab. Fixed images. Limitations: No audio/video, cannot edit once prepared.

content.title: Electronic presentations
content.description: Presentations made quickly using a computer and multimedia projector. Can include multimedia contents such as audio and video.

content.text: A presentation that contains multiple types of contents like numbers, letters, pictures, graphics, images, movies and videos, tables and graphs, voice and sound is called a multimedia electronic presentation.

sections.title: The characteristics of a good quality presentation

content.name: Number of Lines
content.description: It is important to consider the number of lines per slide. The most appropriate number is 6-9 lines per slide.

content.name: Font Size
content.description: The distance between screen and audience is a key factor. It is an accepted norm to keep font size at 32 points or more.

content.name: Correct Use of Grammar and Language
content.description: It is a must that you double check grammar, spellings and use of language by reading slides carefully.

content.name: Inserting Images, Drawings, Tables or Graphs
content.description: It is not suitable to insert more than two images, drawings, tables or graphs in each slide. It may become confusing.

content.name: Use of Colours
content.description: Use dark colours, bold letters or use of different fonts to emphasize certain points. Avoid using dark red colour throughout the slide. Pay attention to contrast of background and foreground colours.

content.name: Animation and Videos
content.description: It is ideal to use one animation or video in each slide. If you use more than one, overlap of sounds may cause confusion to the viewer.

content.name: Pay Attention on Target Group
content.description: When using multimedia, it is important to pay attention to meeting the objectives of the target audience. The content should not divert attention away from the objectives.

content.text: A software which helps to create presentations with multimedia contents is called presentation software.
If MS Office software is not installed in your computer, you can make a presentation using web-based tools (e.g., MS Office 365 PowerPoint, Google Presentation or Microsoft OneDrive PowerPoint).

sections.title: Summary
content: People make presentations to share their views, opinions, ideas and knowledge.
Drumming, flags and speech were common methods of communication in the past.
Slide Projector and Overhead Projector (OHP) were common tools of presentation in the past.
Multimedia Projector allows us to display presentations which are made quickly using a computer. It allows the ability to include multimedia contents such as audio and video.
A presentation that contains multiple types of contents is called a multimedia electronic presentation.
We use various techniques to impart knowledge... gestures, tools to justify one's points to an audience.
It is important to consider the number of lines... Font size... Correct use of grammar and language... Inserting images... Use of colours... Animation and videos... Target group.
Presentation software helps to create presentations with multimedia contents.
Some popular presentation software: Microsoft PowerPoint, LibreOffice Impress, Apple Keynote, Corel Presentation.
Fundamentals of presentation software: Interface components (Ribbon, Slide Pane, Task Pane, Notes Pane, Status Bar).

Creating a presentation: Setting Slide Size, Selecting Theme/Layout, Creating Title Slide, Saving, Opening, Slide Background, Adding Text, Adding Objects, Adding Tables, Symbols, Header/Footer, Columns.
Proofreading includes: Correcting Spelling/Grammar, Using Thesaurus, Finding/Replacing words.
Printing includes: Print Preview, Print, Printing Handouts.
Mail Merge allows sending letters/certificates to several people using a Data Source.
Shortcut keys help for efficient use of application.
Green Computing addresses environmental effects of computing.
A presentation can be projected and printed as a handout.
A printed copy of a presentation can be given to audience. The handouts that are obtained by 'File -> Print' can be distributed to audience.
Manual presentations use slide projector or overhead projector. Electronic presentations use multimedia projector.

Characteristics of good presentations: Number of lines (6-9), Font size (32+), Correct use of grammar/language, Limiting images/diagrams, Use of colours, Animation/Videos, Paying attention to target group.
Cloud computing options allow presentations to be created even when there is no Office in the computer.
